programme.title: Mega Zoo

programme.title: Mega Zoo
programme.desc: Orangutan Malu destroys his playroom; an elderly horse must undergo a dangerous procedure; keepers must decide if it's time to say goodbye to one of the zoo's giraffes.

programme.title: Extinct or Alive

programme.title: Extinct or Alive

programme.title: Extinct or Alive

programme.title: The Dead Don't Die

programme.title: Pieces of April

programme.title: Shiva Baby

programme.title: Barbershop

programme.title: The Dead Don't Die

programme.title: The Snakes
programme.desc: A woman's violent fantasies spiral out of control when she joins a neighborhood watch group.

programme.title: When the Sun Sets
programme.desc: A young nurse fears her activist brother may be in danger in apartheid South Africa.

programme.title: Missing in Action
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) escapes from the Viet Cong, then comes back with a floating arsenal to get others out.

programme.title: Braddock: Missing in Action III
programme.desc: A U.S. colonel (Chuck Norris) returns to Vietnam and fights his way out with his wife, son (Roland Harrah III) and Amerasian orphans.

programme.title: Pulling Strings
programme.desc: Rachel, a diplomatic consul, passes out on a street in Mexico City after a night of drinking. She is rescued by Alejandro, a single father whose visa she rejected the day before, and sparks fly between the two.

programme.title: Fifty Shades Freed
programme.desc: Believing they've left behind the shadowy figures from the past, Christian Grey and his new wife, Anastasia, fully embrace their inextricable connection -- until sinister events start to jeopardize their happy ending before it even begins.

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: A pimp (Terrence Howard) in Memphis, Tenn., sees rap music as the way to escape his dead-end existence and achieve something meaningful.

programme.title: Vacation
programme.desc: Following in his father's (Chevy Chase) footsteps, Rusty Griswold (Ed Helms) takes his wife (Christina Applegate) and two sons on a cross-country road trip to America's favorite fun park, Walley World.

programme.title: Luce
programme.desc: A liberal-minded couple are forced to reconsider their image of their adopted son after he writes a disturbing essay for a class assignment.

programme.title: Ginger & Rosa
programme.desc: In 1962 London, the lifelong friendship between two teenagers (Elle Fanning, Alice Englert) dissolves after one seduces the other's father.

programme.title: I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
programme.desc: When bureaucratic red tape prevents him from naming his children as life insurance beneficiaries, a firefighter (Kevin James) asks his buddy (Adam Sandler) to pose as his domestic partner.

programme.title: Climax
programme.desc: When members of a dance troupe are lured to an empty school, drug-laced sangria causes their jubilant rehearsal to descend into a dark and explosive nightmare as they try to survive the night -- and find out who's responsible -- before it's too late.

programme.title: Never Goin' Back
programme.desc: Angela and Jessie are best friends intent on taking a wild beach trip, but when their roommate loses all of their money in a drug scam, the girls -- blissfully stoned -- go to increasingly daring and absurd lengths to get it back.

programme.title: Carrie
programme.desc: Tormented by her peers and sheltered by her religious mother (Julianne Moore), an awkward teenager (Chloë Grace Moretz) unleashes her hidden, telekinetic powers after a sick prank at her senior prom pushes her over the edge.

programme.title: Cujo
programme.desc: Bitten by a rabid bat, a huge dog traps a Maine woman (Dee Wallace) and her young son (Danny Pintauro) in their Ford Pinto.

programme.title: Predators
programme.desc: On an alien planet, a mercenary (Adrien Brody) and his ragtag band of fighters struggle to survive against an onslaught of fearsome warriors who hunt them for sport.

programme.title: Poltergeist III
programme.desc: Destructive demons follow a little girl (Heather O'Rourke) sent to live with her aunt (Nancy Allen) and uncle (Tom Skerritt) in a Chicago high-rise.

programme.title: Barbershop 2: Back in Business
programme.desc: The owner (Ice Cube) of a barbershop faces pressure from a corporation that is opening establishments in his neighborhood.

programme.title: Pawn Sacrifice
programme.desc: American chess legend Bobby Fischer (Tobey Maguire) and Soviet Grandmaster Boris Spassky (Liev Schreiber) enthrall the world with their intense battle of wills and strategy during the 1972 World Chess Championship.

programme.title: Yes Man
programme.desc: After attending a self-help seminar, a negative-thinking man (Jim Carrey) brings about an amazing change in his life by saying yes to everything.

programme.title: Morris From America
programme.desc: A 13-year-old rapper (Markees Christmas) focused on hip-hop stardom falls for a rebellious classmate (Lina Keller) after moving from the U.S. to Germany with his widowed father (Craig Robinson).

programme.title: Laggies
programme.desc: Caught in a panic over her boyfriend's marriage proposal, Megan pretends to go on a business trip but, in reality, hangs out with a teenage friend, Annika.

programme.title: How to Talk to Girls at Parties
programme.desc: Worlds collide when Enn, a shy teenager in 1970s London, meets the beautiful and rebellious Zan at a party. They set in motion the ultimate showdown between their rivaling worlds and test the limits of how far they will go for true love.

programme.title: The Company You Keep
programme.desc: After a reporter (Shia LaBeouf) uncovers his real identity, a former Weather Underground activist (Robert Redford) goes on the run to track down his former lover (Julie Christie), a fellow member of his cell who never gave up the fight.

programme.title: Music Within
programme.desc: After losing most of his hearing in the Vietnam War, Richard Pimentel (Ron Livingston) becomes a motivational speaker and a driving force behind the Americans With Disabilities Act.

programme.title: Pathology
programme.desc: A medical intern (Milo Ventimiglia) discovers his colleagues are playing a deadly game in which one commits the perfect murder, then the others compete to find the cause of death.

programme.title: The Field Guide to Evil
programme.desc: This global anthology of eight narratives explores dark folklore through a series of myths and tales that have captivated, galvanized and frightened communities throughout history.

programme.title: You're Next
programme.desc: Members of an estranged, upper-class family must pull together to repel home invaders who are disguised in animal masks and trying to kill them.

programme.title: The Rover
programme.desc: After thieves steal his car, a hardened loner (Guy Pearce) forces a wounded member (Robert Pattinson) of their gang to help him track them down across a scorched and perilous landscape.

programme.title: American Heist
programme.desc: Within 24 hours of being released from a 10-year sentence, Frankie (Adrien Brody) threatens to drag his brother James (Hayden Christensen) back into the criminal underworld that nearly swallowed them both years before.
